channel.title: [C4D] For my dad. (Background)
channel.description:
I don't know, i made it because he likes golf and he still had the original 'Acer' wallpaper on his laptop. Golfball looks a bit odd but simple CC for realism?
[img]http://img386.imageshack.us/img386/6397/widescrnbackno5.jpg[/img]

item.title: [C4D] For my dad. (Background)
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

the dimples in golf balls are a lot smoother looking.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] For my dad. (Background)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:4, topic:222946”]Ball too reflective. Indents not done right.

How’d you do them? I think I remember how I did one that’s like a perfect recreation.

Make a icosahedron sphere or whatever, and then select all points, bevel them, and scale them in.

There was a tutorial like that that gives perfect results.

Golfballs gradually go inwards, like many spheres were booled. Yours just looks like it rolled over some imprints, see how they’re flat circles?[/quote]
I see how its imprints, and yes i used the icosahedron sphere and made points into polygons and scaled and beveled.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] For my dad. (Background)
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Ball too reflective. Indents not done right.

How’d you do them? I think I remember how I did one that’s like a perfect recreation.

Make a icosahedron sphere or whatever, and then select all points, bevel them, and scale them in.

There was a tutorial like that that gives perfect results.

Golfballs gradually go inwards, like many spheres were booled. Yours just looks like it rolled over some imprints, see how they’re flat circles?

Read full topic

item.description:

I tried that, im not really good with grass and hair. He said he likes the reflective floor, But ill give the grass a shot.
